medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Chest pain developed two weeks before the current presentation, steadily increasing in severity. The pain was sharp, localized to the left lower chest wall, exacerbated by inspiration but unaffected by exertion or body position. The patient also experienced chills and night sweats, without fever, and the pain was associated with nausea and episodic emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes mellitus diagnosed approximately 4 years prior, complicated by poor glycemic control and episodes of diabetic ketoacidosis. Childhood asthma. Multiple skin and soft-tissue infections, including a left axillary abscess and cellulitis 18 months prior, a right peritonsillar abscess 9 months prior, and a right posterior auricular abscess 6 months prior.
medical_history.family_history: Diabetes mellitus of unknown type in the mother, sister, and maternal uncle; no family history of renal disease.
medical_history.social_history: Sexually active with women using barrier contraception; no history of sexually transmitted infections. Never used tobacco, did not drink alcohol, and reported no active use of illicit substances. Has never been homeless or incarcerated.
